c74object.name: ibufconcatenate~
c74object.digest: Concatenate buffers into one and store item data
c74object.description: The ibufconcatenate~ object is used to handle data to do with sections of a buffer~. It can be used in one of two ways. Firstly - entries - store start and end points for items in a buffer by entering them manually. Secondly - concatenation - concatenate multiple msp buffers into one buffer~, storing start and end points. The bounds of each chunk can be retrieved either as a message, or as a signal in a sample-accurate manner, according to the mode of the object. The ibufconcatedrive~ object can also be used to give sample-accurate playback of only one item at a time.

objarg.name: (i)buffer-name
objarg.description: The first argument is the ibuffer~ /buffer~ to attach to. This is where contents will be stored when ibufconcatenate~ recieves an append / entry message.

objarg.name: mode
objarg.description:
The second argument sets the mode for ibufconcatenate~.
mode 0 allows querying and reporting with signals.
mode 1 allows querying and reporting with messages
If no mode is set, ibufconcatenate~ defualts to mode 0 .

method.name: signal
method.description:
Query an item in the set ibuffer~ /buffer~ by inputting its index/item as a signal.
This will then output the start/end times in milliseconds of the chosen item.
This only works in mode 0.

method.name: message
method.description:
Query an item in the set ibuffer~ /buffer~ by inputting its index/item as an int message.
Inputting a -1 will output the whole buffer.
This will then output the start time, end time and buffer sample rate as a list.
This only works in mode 1.

method.name: append
method.digest: Append a buffers conents as the next item.
method.description:
Append the contents of an ibuffer~ /buffer~ to the last item added.
The message should be formatted as:
append / buffer name
When clicked, the last entry will be output as a list from the fifth outlet.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears all the entries set using the entry or append messages.

method.name: entry
method.digest: Add an entry in reference to the (i)buffer
method.description:
Add an entry in reference to audio already in the ibuffer~ /buffer~.
The message should be formatted as:
entry / start millisecond / end millisecond
When clicked, the last entry will be output as a list from the fifth outlet.

method.name: set
method.description: Set the ibuffer~ /buffer~ to attach to. This is where contents will be stored when ibufconcatenate~ recieves an append / entry message.

entry.name: Outputs
entry.description:
When set to mode 0:
The first outlet outputs the start time in milliseconds.
The second outlet outputs the High-Res start.
The third outlet outputs the end time in milliseconds.
The fourth outlet outputs the High-Res end.
The fifth outlet outputs the last item added as a list (Number / start time (ms) / end time (ms))
When set to mode 1:
The first outlet outputs the start time, end time and buffer sample rate as a list.
The second outlet outputs the last item added as a list (Number / start time (ms) / end time (ms))
